column1: 4.2.4.3.2.6.1	Summary of evidence and recommendations for other treatments for uncomplicated stress   urinary incontinence
Offer mechanical devices to women with mild-to-moderate SUI who fail conservative   treatment only as part of a well-conducted research trial.

Inform women receiving artificial urinary sphincter or adjustable compression device (ACTÂ®)   that, although cure is possible, even in expert centres there is a high risk of complications,   mechanical failure, or a need for explantation.
